message: a lot of the apps I work on render and act differently on different browsers, so I've been working on an app that puts relevant values into the request object: https://github.com/chrisdrackett/django-browser-info
its based on the minidetector app, but I've made so many changes I think it deserved its own app
anyways, I thought I would post it here to get the word out.. and in case anyone had feedback!
things like if the device is iOS, if its android, if it has a wide screen, etc
not that my code can detect that stuff
I can't really think of an instance where I'd rather use this than CSS media queries or JS feature detection (ala Modernizr), but this looks neat nonetheless.
I think a site should work with JS turned off
I could do it with CSS, but this way I don't have to send extra bits to the phone if they aren't going to be displayed

If JS is off you just display your normal page, modernizr shows you once you're in Javascript what features you have available that you could only use from Javascript in the first place. (it does a lot of other neat stuff too, but that's besides the point)
but with JS off you won't be able to detect browser features with modernizr
